text: Gerald Isaac "Jerry" Stiller (June 8, 1927 â€“ May 11, 2020) was an American comedian and actor. He spent many years in the comedy team Stiller and Meara with his wife Anne Meara. Stiller and Meara are the parents of Ben Stiller (with whom he co-starred in the movies Zoolander, Heavyweights, Hot Pursuit, and The Heartbreak Kid) and Amy Stiller. He is best known for his recurring role as Frank Costanza in Seinfeld and his supporting role as Arthur Spooner in The King of Queens. ==Early life== Stiller was the oldest of four children, Stiller was born in Brooklyn, New York City, the son of Jewish parents, Bella (nee Citrin) and William Stiller, a bus driver. His paternal grandparents immigrated from Galicia, and his mother was born in Poland. ==Marriage and family== Stiller married Anne Meara in 1954 and had two children together, Ben Stiller and Amy Stiller. ==Personal life== Stiller lived in New York City, New York. ==Death== On May 11, 2020, Stiller died at his home in New York City, New York of natural causes at the age of 92. ==References== ==Other websites== * * Category:1927 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Actors from New York City Category:American movie actors Category:American stage actors Category:American television actors Category:American voice actors Category:Comedians from New York City Category:Jewish American actors Category:Jewish American comedians Category:Seinfeld
